\subsubsection[{case\+Ins\+Char\+Compare\+N(char a, char b)}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}bool jmh\+Utilities\+::case\+Ins\+Char\+Compare\+N (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{char}]{a, }
\item[{char}]{b}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [inline]}, {\ttfamily [static]}}\label{classjmh_utilities_a84bfacd7fd46a2e57085a75ac039019d}
Compare two characters in a case-\/insensitive manner by converting them both to uppercase and then testing if they are equal. 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em a} & the first character to compare \\
\hline
{\em b} & the second character to compare \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
true if the two uppercase characters are equal, false otherwise 
\end{DoxyReturn}

\hypertarget{classjmh_utilities_a616b99ea8f748dacbbc2775a873d898c}{}\index{jmh\+Utilities@{jmh\+Utilities}!trim@{trim}}
\index{trim@{trim}!jmh\+Utilities@{jmh\+Utilities}}
\subsubsection[{trim(string str)}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}string jmh\+Utilities\+::trim (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{string}]{str}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)\hspace{0.3cm}{\ttfamily [static]}}\label{classjmh_utilities_a616b99ea8f748dacbbc2775a873d898c}
Trim leading and trailing white space (spaces, tabs, and newlines) from the string passed as an argument and return the trimmed string. This version is more sophisticated than the one above. It uses iterators and an improved search technique. 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em str} & string to trim (a copy, so that the original is not destroyed) \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
a copy of the original string with leading and trailing white space removed 
\end{DoxyReturn}
